primary_program: blood and marrow transplant and cellular immunotherapy
overview: I am a myeloma specialist focusing on novel treatments and immunotherapy in myeloma. Also interested in risk and response adapted approach to therapy, as well as in immunotherapy related toxicities.
research_interests:
Dr. Alsina is a specialist in multiple myeloma and bone marrow transplantation and cellular immunotherapy. Her clinical research focuses on the evaluation of novel drugs and combinations to treat myeloma and target minimal residual disease. She is the principal investigator of multiple myeloma studies focusing on maintenance therapy both post transplants;ant and post CART and novel immunotherapies in the relapsed and newly diagnosed settings. Dr. Alsina has served as a member of NCCN Myeloma Panel and the NCI Myeloma Steering Committee, as well as professional organizations such as the International Myeloma Society and the American Society of Hematology. She is actively involved in organizing educational programs for myeloma patients and co-chairs the Annual Hematologic Malignancies Program. 
  *

participating_trials.title: Intermediate-Size Population Expanded Access Program (EAP) for Ciltacabtagene Autoleucel (cilta-cel) Out-of-Specification (OOS) in Patients with Multiple Myeloma

A Phase 3, Two-stage, Randomized, Multi-center, Controlled, Open-label Study Comparing Iberdomide Maintenance to Lenalidomide Maintenance Treatment after Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation (ASCT) in Participants with Newly Diagnosed Multiple Myeloma (NDMM)
Long-term Follow-up Study for Participants Previously Treated with Ciltacabtagene Autoleucel
Phase II study of Elranatamab as maintenance therapy post ciltacabtagene-autoleucel(cilta-cel) in patients with clinical high risk relapsed myeloma
